climbs.name: There is a Bat in my Backpack

content.description: Cool varied route that climbs a thin flake to a slab to the upper dihedral of the Cookie Monster Corner.
content.protection: Standard rack, gear anchor. TCU useful.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. Located 15' right of the 5.6 Free Solo. Best to actually start 10' right of the finish of the 5.6 Free Solo. Off of Sesame Street Ledge.

climbs.name: Predisposition
climbs.fa: Chris Morrsett, Wesley Jones, Pete McKinnen, Steven Stone, and Joshua Reinig 2005

content.description: The tech, crimpy and somewhat contrived, squeeze job face climb ascending the steepest section of the main wall.
content.protection: Bolted anchor.
content.location: Face just right of the Dirty Dihedral. Start of face is marked with an old bolt and one old chopped bolt.

content.description: Cool varied route, climbing both the left and right side of the Sesame Street Buttress.
content.protection: 1 old bolt, standard rack. Bolted anchor on top of buttress.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. Starts as for Ernie's arête, climb short face past old bolt and instead of continuing up to arête, step right and finish as for Big Bird.

content.description: Classic splitter lay back, to superb jug haul bolted face.
content.protection: Gear to 2". Bolted anchor.
content.location: The obvious lay back splitter flake to bolted face located in the middle of the main wall, Cougar Crag West.

content.description: The direct start of the Original Route is a bold run out crimpy/slabby face, that links into the Original Route. Due to the historic nature of this route the antique quarter inch bolts and rusted Leeper hangers have been left in place. Leading this route is not advised, climb at your own risk.
content.protection: 7 quick draws. First 3 bolts are old school up to old school midway belay anchors. Continue up Original Route head wall on 3 newer bolts. Bolted anchor.
content.location: Follow Quarry Trail to mail wall of Cougar Crag West. Climb starts at toe of slab bottom left of Main Wall. 20' down and left of standard start of The Original Route.

climbs.name: Mel's Climb
climbs.fa: Melissa Jane, Joshua Reinig and Brent Bohem 2005

content.description: Mel's climb is a short but exciting edgy face climb. If it had a clean landing it would be a boulder problem. Due to the of the deck nature of the start it was bolted to make for a good mini sport lead.
content.protection: 3 bolts. Small tree anchor.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. Follow Quarry Trail to the amphitheater, which is located just after the Sesame Street Buttress. Mel's climb is the short bolted face on the right side of the amphitheater.

content.description: Splitter finger crack with excellent positioning. One of the better cracks found at any of the circuits.
content.protection: Gear to 3/4". Same anchor as The Great White Pillar.
content.location: Obvious splitter finger crack, splitting the right side of The Great White Pillar. Cougar Crag West.

content.description: Super classic off the deck traverse. It is possible to do a wildly cool reverse iron cross at the extremely exposed crux.
content.protection: Standard rack. Bolted anchors.
content.location: Follow Quarry Trail to Main Wall of Cougar Crag West. The Iron Cross Traverse starts pitch 1 as for the Original Route. Pitch 2, from bolted anchors atop the Original Route traverse foot rail unprotected out right 25' to the Grassy Gully. From here continue out right on face features underneath head wall roof. At the end of this section is the 15' long crux. Climb ends at oak tree on top of the Sesame Street Buttress.

content.description: On the left side of THE Great WHITE Pillar is a cool double overhang, split by a perfect finger crack. The crack will end and turn into a cool shallow exposed corner. When this ends after one BL continue up last few moves of TGWP.
content.protection: Standard rack, use TGWP anchor.

content.description: Superb technical face and slab climbing up an amazing round blunt arête/pillar! Perfect bulletproof white granite with great positioning and exposure.
content.protection: SLCD's up to 3". 3 bolts. 2 bolt anchor with rap rings.
content.location: The Great White Pillar is found at the extreme left end of Cougar Crag West. Follow Quarry Trail all the way to the Western most portion of the main wall. Once at the main wall, the GWP will be the obvious pillaresque formation to climbers left.

content.description: The Grassy Gully climbs the ugly and uninviting looking gully/dihedral just right of the Original Route.
content.protection: Standard rack, gardening tools.

content.description: Steep face to splitter dihedral to radical overhanging arête. The crux is extremely ran out.
content.protection: 1 bolt protects the lower face. Gear to 1". Bolted anchor.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. Obvious steep arête making up the apex of the Sesame Street Buttress. Same start as for Oscar the Grouch, marked by a bolt on the face.

content.description: Classic varied double hand crack situated in an amazing right facing corner.
content.protection: Gear to 3". Can top out on Great White Pillar or better yet climb up and right to bolted anchor for the Original Route PG13.
content.location: Obvious large right facing corner, made up of the right side of the Great White Pillar and the main wall.

content.description: Climb cracks in corner up to more obtuse cracks and the crux mantles. Finish up on slab with intermittent pro to spot near big Bush with tons of anchor options.
content.protection: Standard rack, gear anchor. Use any of the anchors to surrounding routes to descend.
content.location: Start just left of the hidden finger crack. This is on the left hand side of the great white pillar. The route follows up the side of the GWP.

content.description: The Sesame Street Corner is the large dark red dihedral that splits the Main Wall from the Sesame Street Buttress. Great climb with great positioning.
content.protection: Standard rack. Gear anchor.

content.description: Climb up over death flake to beautiful technical crimp fest.
content.protection: Gear anchor to 3".
content.location: Follow Quarry Trail to Main Wall. Steep technical face with giant horizontal death flake marking the start of the route. Farthest left margin of Main Wall. 15' left of The Great White Pillar.

climbs.name: The Black Arch
climbs.fa: Jonathan Reinig, Joshua Reinig and Brent Bohem

content.description: Beautiful right arching dihedral to under cling roof, on impeccable dark orange granite. Crack in dihedral goes from perfect hands to tips. When roof peters out it is possible to continue up Original Route face or back up and left on grassy ledge/flake system.
content.protection: Standard Rack. Original Route bolted anchor.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. The Black Arch is obvious right trending black arch in the middle of the main wall. It starts just right of the Dirty Dihedral.

content.description: Big Bird is an excellent adventure route. It starts at the toe of the Sesame Street Buttress via an improbable but do able off width/squeeze chimney. From here route wanders up and left to amazing crack in a large right facing alcove. When this ends climb steep face up and left one BL to surmount top of buttress.
content.protection: Standard rack. Bolted anchor atop buttress.

content.description: Beautiful steep and exposed face climb on great rock. Sustained sporty climbing will get you to the top. Gear is sparse and precise.
content.protection: Gear to 1". Bolted anchor.
content.location: Cougar Crag West. The obvious steep face 15' right of the Sesame Street Corner on the Sesame Street Buttress.

content.description: Bitchen hand crack to a roof encounter in  left facing corner. Great rock climb is short and sweet.
content.protection: Standard rack. Gear anchor.
content.location: 5.6 FS is found 20' down and right of The Grassy Gully.
